page.lettertext:
fol.167r
[.]
1594 30 Au
g.
To M
r
Bodly
By the Queene
Elizabeth R
Trusty and welbeloved We greete yowe well. Whe
reas [you]
have had ordre to deale w
th
the States
for sundry thing
[.]
we are not well satisfied, and that yourselfe have made req
[uest]
to us to have our licence for your retourne, we are well plea
[sed]
therw
th
. requiring you to consider afore your comming then
[.]
we were best to proceede w
th
those Stat
for rembursment of
[.]
greate charges. And so at your comming we may deale ther
[.]
sending for some to be authorized by the Stat
to come hith
[.]
make the accompt
perfect betwene us and them for our charg
[es]
so afterward
to procure the rembursement, as in reason we
[.]
cause to requier the same, considering our greate charges ot
[.]
and their habilitie nowe in force by the late recovering of
[.]
ghen, to satisfie us herein.
Gyven under our Signet
[.]
Manour of Grenewiche the xxx
th
daye of August.
1594
.
[.]
xxxvi
th
yere of our Reigne.
